page.title: 15SCOTTS HOUSE FARM
page.content: Scotts house farm in Gosforth has 110 acres of land. It is owned by Mr. Leech, the Builder. Mr. Oliver is the tenant-farmer. There is farm house and two cottages. There is no mains electricity so they have a big generator for the houses and a small one for the farm machinery. The farm has 5 tractors and 2 combines and until 1960 was a dairy farm. Then there was a change to arable farming. Three years ago beef cattle were introduced so now it is a mixed farm. There are 30 cows, 20 calves and 1 bull. This year's crops are spring and winter barley, wheat, peas, grass, potatoes and rape. It is planned to put more acreage put to grass to increase the fertility of the land as continual use of fertilisers make it sterile.
